item.title: Five Virtual Reality Predictions for CES 2016
item.description:
Five Virtual Reality Predictions for CES 2016

CES 2016 is upon us. Oculus will open preorders for the Rift. HTC will unveil its new Vive. It's like Christmas for VR enthusiasts. But what else will we see, and why? Here's what we think.

item.title: HTC Vive Pre An Improvement, Not Necessarily A 'Breakthrough'... Yet - UploadVR
item.description:
HTC Vive Pre An Improvement, Not Necessarily A 'Breakthrough'... Yet - UploadVR

It turns out, the "very big breakthrough" HTC was having us wait for is nothing more than an AR overlay from the front-facing camera.

item.title: The HTC Vive 'Breakthrough' likely to be Improved Optics
item.description:
The HTC Vive 'Breakthrough' likely to be Improved Optics

Why would HTC, who already came very close to alienating its fledgling and enthusiastic community by suddenly delaying the release of the HTC Vive virtual reality headset until April 2016, stack the deck even further against themselves by attributing the delay to a 'very big breakthrough?'

item.title: Oculus Rift Pre-Orders to Open on January 6
item.description:
Oculus Rift Pre-Orders to Open on January 6

Today, we're excited to announce that pre-orders for Rift will open on Oculus.com at 8am Pacific Time on January 6! We'll be sharing everything you need to know to order your Rift on Wednesday when pre-orders go live. As a reminder, every Rift comes bundled with Lucky's Tale by Playful, and we're also including CCP's EVE: Valkyrie for free with every pre-order!

item.title: HTC/Valve releases new "Viveport" storefront and developer login - BitVRse
item.description:
HTC/Valve releases new "Viveport" storefront and developer login - BitVRse

HTC/Valve have launched their web portal for HTC Vive developers and to users(it would suggest) as a means of content marketplace it seems. The site allows users to register an account set their account privacy setting (Relating to posting, activity history, post following and profile details) .

item.title: NVIDIA Launches 'GTX Geforce VR Ready' PC Program - Road to VR
item.description:
NVIDIA Launches 'GTX Geforce VR Ready' PC Program - Road to VR

NVIDIA has announced a new program designed to alleviate confusion for consumers wanting to ensure their next PC or notebook computer is capable of running consumer VR applications when VR headsets hit the market next year.

item.title: VR Skeptic? These 3 PlayStation Demos Will Make You a Believer
item.description:
VR Skeptic? These 3 PlayStation Demos Will Make You a Believer

Experiencing is believing and Shuhei Yoshida, president of Sony Corp.'s worldwide game studios, has three virtual reality demos he wants every skeptic to try. Sony's PlayStation VR is a face-covering display that takes over a user's sense of sight, while sensors mimic the body's subconscious mechanisms responsible for balance.

item.title: Samsung to Demo Gear VR Motion Controller at CES 2016 - Road to VR
item.description:
Samsung to Demo Gear VR Motion Controller at CES 2016 - Road to VR

Samsung to Demo Gear VR Motion Controller ‘rink’ at CES 2016

item.title: Lucky's Tale to be Bundled with Every Oculus Rift
item.description:
Lucky's Tale to be Bundled with Every Oculus Rift

Today, we're excited to announce that Lucky's Tale, the incredible made-for-VR platformer by Playful, will be included free with every Oculus Rift! Lucky's Tale, an Oculus Studios title, takes you on an adventure of a lifetime with Lucky, the fun-loving fox. The game takes you to a charming new world, with dozens of locales and lush environments.

item.title: Being There: A New ArchViz Demo With A Twist
item.description:
Being There: A New ArchViz Demo With A Twist

VR is perfect for the visualization of beautiful architecture. But what if there's more to it than just exploring a space?
